definition: to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price

sentences.english: All the markups would cancel each other out.
sentences.chinese: 所有的漲價都會彼此抵消。

sentences.english: The earthquake-hit regions will be exempt from the hike, the central bank said.
sentences.chinese: 央行還表示地震重災區法人金融機構暫不漲價。

sentences.english: The second question is whether the increases reflect supply or demand-side factors.
sentences.chinese: 第二個問題是，漲價是否反映供需方面的因素。

sentences.english: Indiscriminate price rises for some commodities were often directly related to the pursuit of bonuses by certain enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 有些商品亂漲價，也與一些企業追求多得獎金有關。

sentences.english: Plus, they bring out a special menu where everything is overpriced.
sentences.chinese: 而且，他們給你拿上來的都是瘋狂漲價的特別菜單。

sentences.english: Other companies in Foshan say they are raising prices by about 20%.
sentences.chinese: 佛山其他一些玩具廠則表示要漲價20%左右。

sentences.english: Producers of potash, a key fertilizer, should prosper mightily from food inflation.
sentences.chinese: 主要肥料碳酸鉀的生產商，應能在食品漲價中發財。

sentences.english: Because your order is too small, we have to increase our price by 5%.
sentences.chinese: 因爲貴公訂貨太少，我們只好漲價5%。

sentences.english: Florida Freeze To Increase Area Produce Prices. (The Freeze In Florida Is To Increase The Areas Produce Prices. )
sentences.chinese: 佛羅里達嚴冷將使該地區農產品漲價。

sentences.english: Bus and taxi fares will be raised next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年公共汽車費和出租車費要漲價。

sentences.english: The charge for the taxi will be increased next month.
sentences.chinese: 出租車費下個月要漲價。

sentences.english: The rising food prices have helped fuel protests and strikes by working professionals around the country.
sentences.chinese: 在埃及各地，食品漲價引發了在職人員的抗議和罷工。

sentences.english: The new increase would see contract prices for iron ore range around $140 a metric ton.
sentences.chinese: 漲價後，鐵礦石的合約價將達到每噸140美元左右。

sentences.english: Prices were bumped up at news of changes in the income tax laws .
sentences.chinese: 改變所得稅法的消息傳來，各種東西突然漲價了。

sentences.english: All our ingredients have also become expensive -- sugar is costing more, oil is costing more.
sentences.chinese: 糖，油等待所有的配料都漲價了。

sentences.english: Apples are up again this week.

definition: to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
